column4: how can i make a .exe program work in Ubuntu? sorry im new to Linux
if you can't use the .exe, then what can we use? most of the softwares i use are .exe
Take a look at http://freshmeat.net. That site is FULL of software for Linux/Unix, and there are replacements for most of your Windows EWXE files there.
Yes, AUTOCAD will not run on Linux. Alternately though, there are actually better drafting solutions available for Linux for free.
can you name me one please?
It's been a while. Let me look it up for you.
if you are busy, its okay
There's a program called "Vino" which can allow you give someone remote control of your desktop. The program to connect to a remote dekstop session is called VNC = Virtual Network Computing
and i can see the computer with linux on my network with that same software?
Linux, Windows, Mac, it runs on all of them... All you need to know is the address of the computer.
and i already have this software or i should download it?
In fact, there are several CAAD packages available in the Ubunutu package manager.
